channel.title: What the fudge

item.title: What the fudge
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“Snow_, post:4, topic:548176”]I don’t know enough about this to be sure about it, but I found something which might explain it here: http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/iostream/

[quote]Including automatically includes also , , , and .[/quote][/quote][quote=“Mopman, post:5, topic:548176”]Because the programs aren’t similar in complexity.

The C++ example is using streams, involves multiple data types etc… the C code does none of this.[/quote][quote=“t4, post:6, topic:548176”]C++ is not C, for one there’s a symbolv table and name mangling in C++. Also a character array is not the same as a string class.[/quote]Thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: What the fudge
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

I think it’s because your curly brace isn’t on a new line, nor does it even have a space after the right parenthesis…

I don’t know enough about this to be sure about it, but I found something which might explain it here: http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/iostream/

Including automatically includes also , , , and .

item.title: What the fudge
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“justaguy, post:2, topic:548176”]Well the length of your output is probably due mainly to the iostream header.[/quote]To take a bit of a tangent from this, in C:

[code=c]#include <stdio.h>

int main(void){
printf(“Hello World\n”);
return 0;
}[/code]

produces

[code=asm] .section __TEXT,__text,regular,pure_instructions
.globl _main
.align 4, 0x90
_main: ## @main

BB#0:

pushq	%rbp
movq	%rsp, %rbp
subq	$16, %rsp
leaq	L_.str(%rip), %rdi
movl	$0, -4(%rbp)
movb	$0, %al
callq	_printf
movl	$0, %ecx
movl	%eax, -8(%rbp)          ## 4-byte Spill
movl	%ecx, %eax
addq	$16, %rsp
popq	%rbp
retq

.section	__TEXT,__cstring,cstring_literals

L_.str: ## @.str
.asciz “Hello World\n”

.subsections_via_symbols[/code]

Why is the ASM equivalent from the C++ program so much more code when the program is similar in complexity?

Read full topic

item.title: What the fudge
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

Well the length of your output is probably due mainly to the iostream header.

item.title: What the fudge
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[code=cpp]#include

int main(void){
std::cout << “Hello World” << std::endl;
return EXIT_SUCCESS;
}[/code]

with

[font=courier]g++ -S test.cpp[/font]

produces http://pastebin.com/raw.php?i=UmbPWFAF

on my Macbook Pro (OS X Yosemite)

Read full topic
